title: ImportError: numpy.core.multiarray failed to import
body:
This issue is happening inside the docker container. 

Dockerfile content:

FROM continuumio/miniconda3:4.8.2
WORKDIR /app
COPY requirements.txt /app/
COPY lib/ /app/lib/
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
COPY . /app/
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-m", "api"]


requirements.txt is having dependencies pinned:

numpy==1.17.3
shap==0.36.0


Exception from shap.

C extension was not built during install!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/app/dd/__main__.py", line 136, in <module>
    main()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/app/dd/__main__.py", line 121, in main
    run_training_and_eval_pipeline(data_layer, NODES)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/pipeline/pipeline.py", line 27, in run_training_and_eval_pipeline
    offline_training_pipeline_dag.run()
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/dag/dag.py", line 49, in run
    func_returns = [node() for node in self.nodes]
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/dag/dag.py", line 49, in <listcomp>
    func_returns = [node() for node in self.nodes]
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/functional_pipeline_utils/wrappers.py", line 65, in _in
    data = fn(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/functional_pipeline_utils/wrappers.py", line 99, in _in
    data = fn(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ai_factory/functional_pipeline_utils/wrappers.py", line 116, in _in
    data = fn(*data_args)
  File "/app/dd/nodes/modelling/model_generation.py", line 157, in generate_model
    model=final_model, data=all_scf_training_data, features_list=feature_names, path_to_model=path_to_root_folder
  File "/app/dd/nodes/modelling/model_explanation.py", line 53, in explain_model
    model, data=data[features_list], model_output="probability", feature_perturbation="interventional"
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 136, in __init__
    self.model = TreeEnsemble(model, self.data, self.data_missing, model_output)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 650, in __init__
    self.trees = [SingleTree(e.tree_, normalize=True, scaling=scaling, data=data, data_missing=data_missing) for e in model.estimators_]
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 650, in <listcomp>
    self.trees = [SingleTree(e.tree_, normalize=True, scaling=scaling, data=data, data_missing=data_missing) for e in model.estimators_]
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 1096, in __init__
    assert_import("cext")
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/utils/_general.py", line 23, in assert_import
    raise e
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py", line 22, in <module>
    from .. import _cext
ImportError: numpy.core.multiarray failed to import
